name: auto:reverse:silence
description: First E.P from The Hubble Constant. Sounds a lot different to present material due to this was recorded prior to Nathan joining the band so no screaming. auto:reverse:silence received 8 out of 10 in a Metal Hammer review, for fans of post rock with a less harsh metal edge. This CD is very rare and all DIY made with fantastic artwork when they are gone there gone so get one right away might be worth some money one day ay. At under 4.00 and free p&p, bargin!! METAL HAMMER REVIEW auto:reverse:silence sounding not unlike the fall of troy, the hubble constant bring a number of influences to a great sound. Think Tool’s mindset, the instrumental precision of opeth, the erratic energy of every time i die and a very LA garage-rock vocal run through an amp. With an abstract name like Hubble you get what you’d expect: strange music. Diverse sounds like reggae rhythms, crashing crescendos and whispered vocals make this a particularly eerie and intruiging CD 8/10”

name: i sin + cos cassette released by Third Arm Records
description: Uber rare, so so pretty and awsome packaging. 5 tracks of hubble goodness comes with a free CD-R. Released by Third Arm Records

name: BRAND NEW S/T The Hubble Constant CDEP
description: New release for 2009, branding spanking new ep, 6 dudes from the West Midlands, awesome packaging, great price, what more do you want? released by the good people at Post Collapse Records.
